00017 package WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Logout;
00018 use base qw(WeBWorK::ContentGenerator);
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::Logout - invalidate key and display logout message.
00023 
00024 =cut
00025 
00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 #use CGI qw(-nosticky );
00029 use WeBWorK::CGI;
00030 use WeBWorK::Cookie;
00031 use WeBWorK::Localize;
00032 
00033 
00034 sub pre_header_initialize {
00035     my ($self) = @_;
00036     my $r = $self->r;
00037     my $ce = $r->ce;
00038     my $db = $r->db;
00039     my $authen = $r->authen;
00040     
00041     # get rid of stored authentication info (this is kind of a hack. i have a better way
00042     # in mind but it requires pretty much rewriting Authen/Login/Logout. :-( FIXME)
00043     $authen->forget_verification;
00044     
00045     my $cookie = WeBWorK::Cookie->new($r,
00046         -name => "WeBWorKAuthentication",
00047         -value => "",
00048         -expires => "-1D",
00049         -domain => $r->hostname,
00050         -path => $ce->{webworkURLRoot},
00051         -secure => 0,
00052     );
00053     $r->headers_out->set("Set-Cookie" => $cookie->as_string);
00054 
00055     my $userID = $r->param("user");
00056     my $keyError = '';
00057     eval { $db->deleteKey($userID) };
00058     if ($@) {
00059         $keyError .= "Something went wrong while logging out of " .
00060             "WeBWorK: $@";
00061     }
00062 
00063     # also check to see if there is a proctor key associated with this 
00064     #    login.  if there is a proctor user, then we must have a 
00065     #    proctored test, so we try and delete the key
00066     my $proctorID = defined($r->param("proctor_user")) ? 
00067         $r->param("proctor_user") : '';
00068     if ( $proctorID ) {
00069         eval { $db->deleteKey( "$userID,$proctorID" ); };
00070         if ( $@ ) {
00071             $keyError .= CGI::p( 
00072                 "Error when clearing proctor key: $@");
00073         }
00074     # we may also have a proctor key from grading the test
00075         eval { $db->deleteKey( "$userID,$proctorID,g" ); };
00076         if ( $@ ) {
00077             $keyError .= CGI::p( 
00078                 "Error when clearing proctor grading key: $@");
00079         }
00080     }
00081     $self->{keyError} = $keyError;
00082 
00083     # if we have an authen redirect, all of those errors may be 
00084     #    moot, but I think that's unavoidable (-glarose)
00085     if ( defined($authen->{redirect}) && $authen->{redirect} ) {
00086         $self->reply_with_redirect( $authen->{redirect} );
00087     }
00088 }
00089 
00090 ## This content generator is NOT logged in.
00091 #sub if_loggedin {

00094 #   return !$arg;

00101 
00102 sub body {
00103     my ($self) = @_;
00104     my $r = $self->r;
00105     my $ce = $r->ce;
00106     my $db = $r->db;
00107     my $urlpath = $r->urlpath;
00108     
00109     my $courseID = $urlpath->arg("courseID");
00110     my $userID = $r->param("user");
00111 
00112     if ( $self->{keyError} ) { 
00113         print CGI::div({class=>"ResultsWithError"}, $self->{keyError});
00114     }
00115     
00116     my $problemSets = $urlpath->newFromModule("WeBWorK::ContentGenerator::ProblemSets",  $r, courseID => $courseID);
00117     my $loginURL = $r->location . $problemSets->path;
00118     
00119     print CGI::p($r->maketext("You have been logged out of WeBWorK."));
00120     
00121     print CGI::start_form(-method=>"POST", -action=>$loginURL);
00122     print CGI::hidden("user", $userID);
00123     print CGI::hidden("force_passwd_authen", 1);
00124     print CGI::p({align=>"center"}, CGI::submit(-name=>"submit", -label=>$r->maketext("Log In Again")));
00125     print CGI::end_form();
00126     
00127     return "";
00128 }
00129 
00130 1;
